means: 使（人或人的身体）非常虚弱( debilitate的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The debilitating disease made him too weak to work.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个令他衰弱的病,使他弱到没有办法工作.

sentence.Network_en: You may soon leave one debilitating condition or relationship forever.
sentence.Network_cn: 你即将永远地和这段霉运说拜拜了.

sentence.Network_en: This syndrome actually highlights the debilitating internal effects of self - pity and self - defeat.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种心态突显了 自我 怜悯和 自我 认输所能造成的挫折感.

Smoking tobacco is responsible for many debilitating diseases such as chronic bronchitis and vascular diseases ., 吸食烟草会造成许多身体衰弱的疾病 , 例如慢性支气管炎及慢性血管疾病.

it also gave us a chance to shape a new concept of international order even while emerging from a debilitating war and a wrenching decade at home它也使我们有机会对国际格局形成一个新概念，虽然我们那时刚刚从一场大伤元气的战争中和国内极度痛苦的十年中解脱出来

list.abs: 其它研究则表明 [8 ] , 焦虑对学习主要是起阻碍作用, 这类焦虑被称为阻碍性焦虑 ( debilitating anxiety) 。为此, 学者们对焦虑的.
一种是退缩性焦虑 （debilitating anxiety）。它使学习者逃避学习任务。
神草 ginseng神衰 debilitated spirit神堂 BL-44\w
偏食异物 perverted appetite偏衰 abnormally debilitated偏衰 abnormally weak
庞培氏病是一种罕见但严重的衰竭性疾病（debilitating disease），急剧降低了人的肌肉及呼吸功能，该病在每4万到30万人中影响1人。

entry.def: If you are debilitated by something such as an illness, it causes your body or mind to become gradually weaker.

example.ex: Stewart took over yesterday when Russell was debilitated by a stomach virus.
example.tran: 昨天拉塞尔因肠胃病毒感染身体不适，由斯图尔特暂时接手。

entry.tran: 削弱（组织、社团或政府）的力量
entry.def: To debilitate an organization, society, or government means to gradually make it weaker.

example.ex: ...their efforts to debilitate the political will of the Western alliance.
example.tran: 他们试图削弱西方联盟的政治决心的努力

auth_sentence.res_content_con: And that led to chronic, debilitating illness.

auth_sentence.content: His stock-in-trade was that debilitating mix of anti-Zionism and anti-Americanism.
